DOC.detailed_description: Using randomize control study design , investigator test efficacy abstinence-reinforcing contingency management intervention compare control condition ( Performance Feedback ) HIV viral load suppression . The investigator enroll 202 opioid-dependent HIV-infected individual receive opioid agonist treatment buprenorphine methadone , continue use opiate , oxycodone cocaine ( drug consistently associate poor HIV treatment outcome ) , prescribed antiretroviral medication , suboptimal viral load suppression . The contingency management group potential receive $ 1320 voucher 16-week intervention base drug-free urine . Participants follow 28 week , research visit occur twice weekly Baseline Period ( week 1-4 ) Intervention Period ( week 5-20 ) , every two week Post-Intervention Period ( week 21-28 ) . Data source include blood test ( viral load CD4 count ) , urine toxicology test , questionnaire , pill count , medical record . The primary outcome change HIV viral load , secondary outcome include CD4 count , antiretroviral adherence , abstinence .
